pages.text: There are four rocket tiers, each with different capabilities and fuel requirements. Higher tiers can travel to more distant planets.

$(bold)Tier 1 Rocket$()$(br)$(br)Your first rocket for reaching nearby destinations.$(br)$(br)$(bold)Fuel:$() Liquid Ethanol$(br)$(br)$(bold)Accessible Planets:$()$(br)- Earth$(br)- Moon$(br)- Earth Orbit

$(bold)Tier 2 Rocket$()$(br)$(br)Improved rocket for reaching the inner planets.$(br)$(br)$(bold)Fuel:$() Liquid Propane$(br)$(br)$(bold)Accessible Planets:$()$(br)- All Tier 1 planets$(br)- Mars$(br)- Mercury

$(bold)Tier 3 Rocket$()$(br)$(br)Advanced rocket for outer system exploration.$(br)$(br)$(bold)Fuel:$() Liquid Ethylene$(br)$(br)$(bold)Accessible Planets:$()$(br)- All Tier 1-2 planets$(br)- Venus$(br)- Glacio$(br)$(br)Fireproof construction.

$(bold)Tier 4 Rocket$()$(br)$(br)The ultimate rocket for deep space exploration.$(br)$(br)$(bold)Fuel:$() Liquid Methane$(br)$(br)$(bold)Accessible Planets:$()$(br)- All Tier 1-3 planets$(br)- Unknown planets via the $(bold)$(#AA55FF)???$() mystery selector$(br)$(br)Greater fuel efficiency for extended expeditions.

pages.title: Cargo Capacity
pages.text: Each rocket has 8 storage slots for cargo$(br)$(br)Use these slots to transport resources between planets, carry oxygen supplies, and store equipment for your missions.
